intro: Consolida hellespontica, commonly known as the Hellenic rocket or Hellenic fennel, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes罂粟 (poppy) and other flowering plants. The plant produces vibrant, spurred flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are upright and often branched. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
